Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: You cannot pass!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Gandalf!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the Flame of Anor!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Argh! Go back to the shadow. The Dark Fire will not avail you, Flame of Udn! [Camera zooms in through the mountain and focuses on Gandalf and the Balrog on the bridge of Khazad-dm. The Balrog strikes down on Gandalf with its flaming sword. Gandalf parries the blow with Glamdring, shattering the Balrogs sword.] YOU SHALL NOT... PASS!!!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Argh!  [Frodo rushes forward but Boromir restrains him.]

Speaker: boromir
Dialogue: No! No!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Gandalf!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Fly, you fools!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Noooooooooooooooo!!!!  [Gandalf loses his grip and falls into the chasm]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Calls after Gandalf as he falls into the abyss] Gaaandaaaaalf!!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Gandalf!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What is it, Mr. Frodo?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Nothing. Just a dream. [Lies back down.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mordor. The one place in Middle-earth we dont want to see any closer, and the one place were trying to get to. Its just where we cant get. Lets face it, Mr. Frodo, were lost. I dont think Gandalf meant for us to come this way.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: He didnt mean for a lot of things to happen, Sam... but they did.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr. Frodo? Its the Ring, isnt it?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Its getting heavier. [Clutches the Ring by his chest and sits down, still panting. He then fumbles for his water bottle and takes a sip.]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: What food have we got left?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Well, let me see. [He takes out a package of lembas bread from his pack] Oh yes, lovely  Lembas bread. And look! [He digs deeper into his pack] More lembas bread.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't usually hold with foreign food, but this Elvish stuff, its not bad.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [smiles] Nothing ever dampens your spirits, does it Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Those rain clouds might.  [They continue trekking through difficult terrain, often huddling underneath their cloaks.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Looks around] This looks strangely familiar.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Exasperated] Its because weve been here before! Were going in circles.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ah! What's that 'orrid stink? I'll warrant there's a nasty bog nearby. Can you smell it?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Yes. I can smell it. [Drops to a whisper] Were not alone.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: The thieves! The thieves! The filthy little thieves! Where is it? Where isss it? They stole it from us. My preciousss. [Gollum creeps closer and closer.] Curse them! We hates them! Its ours, it is... and we wantssss it!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [menacingly] This is Sting. Youve seen it before, havent you... Gollum! Release him or Ill cut your throat!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: It burns! It burns us! It freezes! Nasty Elves twisted it. Take it off us!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Quiet you!  [Sam tugs fiercely at the rope. Gollum cries some more and collapses onto his back. Sam turns to Frodo in dismay.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Its hopeless! Every Orc in Mordors going to hear this racket! Lets just tie him up and leave him.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: No! That would kill us! Kill us!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Its no more than you deserve!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Maybe he does deserve to die, but now that I see him, I do pity him.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Begging] We be nice to them if they be nice to us. Take it off us. We swears to do what you wants. We swears.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Theres no promise you can make that I can trust.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: We swears to serve the master of the preciousss. We swears on... on the precious. *Gollum. Gollum.*

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: The Ring is treacherous. It will hold you to your word.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Yes... on the preciousss. On the preciousss.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I dont believe you! [Gollum backs away, frightened, and climbs onto a boulder] Get down! I said, down!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Sam!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hes trying to trick us! We let him go hell throttle us in our sleep!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: You know the way to Mordor?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [nods warily] Yes...

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Youve been there before?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [nods again] Yes...

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: You will lead us to the Black Gate.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Merry. Merry! [He receives no response.]

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: What is it? What do you smell?

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: [quietly to himself] Aragorn!

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: They've picked up our trail! Let's move!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Their pace has quickened. [He looks up.] They must have caught our scent. Hurry! [He runs off.]

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Come on, Gimli! [Looks back at Gimli and then runs after Aragorn]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [pauses in his steps and huffs] Three days and nights pursuit. No food. No rest. And no sign of our quarry but what bare rock can tell. [Runs after his companions.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Not idly do the leaves of Lrien fall.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: [stops and turns to Aragorn.] They may yet be alive.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Less than a day ahead of us. Come! [Runs off again]

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Come, Gimli! We are gaining on them!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Panting] I am wasted on cross-country! We dwarves are natural sprinters! Very dangerous over short distances!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Rohan. Home of the horse-lords. There is something strange at work here. Some evil gives speed to these creatures, sets its will against us.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Legolas, what do your Elf eyes see?

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: The Uruks turn northeast. Theyre taking the hobbits to Isengard!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Saruman.

Speaker: saruman
Dialogue: The horsemen took your land. They drove your people into the hills to scratch a living off rocks.

Speaker: dunland man
Dialogue: Murderers!

Speaker: saruman
Dialogue: Take back the lands they stole from you! Burn every village!

Speaker: crowd
Dialogue: [Roars with approval] Argh!!  [They stomp off to destroy the villages of Rohan as Saruman stands coldly still among the stampede. A Rohan village is in pandemonium as people try to escape the on-coming pillage.]

Speaker: morwen
Dialogue: othain! othain! You take your sister. Youll go faster with just two.

Speaker: freda
Dialogue: [As Morwen puts her onto the horse in front of her brother] Papa says othain must not ride Garulf, he is too big for him!

Speaker: morwen
Dialogue: Listen to me. You must ride to Edoras and raise the alarm. Do you understand me?

Speaker: othain
Dialogue: Yes, Ma!

Speaker: freda
Dialogue: [starts to cry] I dont wanna leave! I don't wanna go, Mama!

Speaker: morwen
Dialogue: Freda, I will find you there.

Speaker: morwen
Dialogue: Quickly!

Speaker: morwen
Dialogue: [Looks after them] Go child!

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: Thodred!  [Thodred seems to hear her call but is unable to respond. He has a bloody gash on the side of his head. omer nods to owyn in the direction of Thodreds torso. owyn draws back the covers and upon seeing Thodreds fatal wound, her lips tighten and eyes close. She looks up to catch omers eye.]

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: Your son is badly wounded, my lord.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: He was ambushed by Orcs. If we dont defend our country, Saruman will take it by force.

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: That is a lie! [Appears from the shadows.] Saruman the White has ever been our friend and ally.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [mumbles feebly] Grma Grma [Grma leans down close to the King.]My son...? Grma...?

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Orcs are roaming freely across our lands. Unchecked. Unchallenged. Killing at will. Orcs bearing the white hand of Saruman. [He drops a helmet onto the ground, which topples over to reveal the white hand of Saruman.]

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: Why do you lay these troubles on an already troubled mind. Can you not see? Your uncle is wearied by your malcontent, your war-mongering.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: War-mongering?  [omer grabs Grma and pins him against a pillar.]

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: How long is it since Saruman bought you? What was the promised price, Grma? When all the men are dead you will take your share of the treasure?

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Too long have you watched my sister, too long have you haunted her steps.

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: You see much omer, Son of omund. Too much. [The thugs punch omer n the stomach] You are banished forthwith from the kingdom of Rohan. Under pain of death!

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: [Being dragged away] Argh!!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Keep breathing! Thats the key! Breathe! Ho!

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Theyve run as if the very whips of their masters were behind them.

Speaker: mordor orc
Dialogue: Were not going no further till weve had a breather!

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: Get a fire going!  [As the Orcs and Uruk-hai take their rest, Pippin crawls over towards Merry.]

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Merry! Merry!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [opens his eyes] I think... we might have made a mistake leaving the Shire, Pippin.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Whats making that noise?

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [looks towards the forest] Its the trees.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Do you remember the Old Forest? On the borders of Buckland? Folk used to say that there was something in the water that made the trees grow tall... and come alive.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Alive?

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Trees that could whisper. Talk to each other. Even move.

Speaker: mahur
Dialogue: I'm starving. We ain't 'ad nothin' but maggoty bread for three stinkin' days!

Speaker: snaga
Dialogue: Yeah. Why cant we have some meat? [His eyes rest on the hobbits.] What about them? Theyre fresh.

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: They are not for eating!

Speaker: grishnkh
Dialogue: What about their legs? They don't need those. Ooh They look tasty!

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: [Shoves at the Orcs] Get back, scum!

Speaker: mordor orc
Dialogue: Carve them up!

Speaker: snaga
Dialogue: [Moves towards the hobbits with his blade drawn] Just a mouth full.

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: No!  [Pippin and Merry recoil in fright. Uglk jumps on the Orc and cuts off his head, which bounces off the hobbit's shoulders.]

Speaker: uglk
Dialogue: Looks like meats back on the menu, boys!!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Pippin, lets go.  [Their hands still bound, the hobbits try to crawl away. Suddenly a foot comes down on Merry and Pippin is turned onto his back.]

Speaker: grishnkh
Dialogue: [Brandishing a blade in front of Pippins face] Go on, call for help. Squeal! No ones gonna save you now!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Pippin! [Gestures for them to make their escape.]

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: ARGH!!!

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: [Pauses and looks up] A red sun rises. Blood has been spilled this night.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Riders of Rohan, what news from the Mark?

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: What business does an Elf, a man and a Dwarf have in the Riddermark? Speak quickly!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Give me your name, Horsemaster, and I shall give you mine.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: I would cut off your head, Dwarf, if it stood but a little higher from the ground.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: You would die before your stroke fell!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: I am Aragorn, son of Arathorn. This is Gimli, son of Glin and Legolas of the Woodland realm. We are friends of Rohan and of Thoden, your king.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Thoden no longer recognizes friend from foe. [Takes off helmet] Not even his own kin.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Saruman has poisoned the mind of the king and claimed lordship over these lands. My company are those loyal to Rohan. And for that, we are banished. The White Wizard is cunning. He walks here and there, they say, as an old man, hooded and cloaked. And everywhere his spies slip past our nets.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: We are not spies. We track a party of Uruk-hai westward across the plain. Theyve taken two of our friends captive.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: The Uruks are destroyed. We slaughtered them during the night.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: But there were two hobbits. Did you see two hobbits with them?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: They would be small  only children to your eyes.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: We left none alive. We piled the carcasses and burned them. [Points to a smoking pile in the distance.]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Dead?

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: [nods] I am sorry.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Hasufel! Arod! [Two horses move up.] May these horses bear you to better fortune than their former masters. Farewell.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: Look for your friends. But do not trust to hope, it has forsaken these lands. [To the riders] We ride north!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Its one of their wee belts.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: [with his head bowed and eyes closed] Hiro th ab 'wanath...

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Kicks a helmet and yells] AAARRGGHH!!! [He falls to his knees.]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: We failed them.  [Aragorn looks to the side as some tracks catch his attention.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: A hobbit lay here, and the other. [Flashback: Pippin yells as he looks up at a pair of thrashing hooves bearing down on him. He rolls over, avoiding the hooves.] They crawled.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Their hands were bound. [Flashback: Merry rubs his bonds furiously against the sharp edge of a weapon.] Their bonds were cut. [Aragorn holds up a broken length of thick rope.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: They ran over here. They were followed.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: The belt!  [Pippin undoes his belt and Grishnkh is left holding it.]

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: The tracks lead away from the battle... [They break into a run and then stop] into Fangorn Forest.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Fangorn. What madness drove them in there?

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Did we lose him? [Looks around] I think we lost him.

Speaker: grishnkh
Dialogue: Im gonna rip out your filthy little innards! Come here!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Trees! Climb a tree!  [Pippin and Merry quickly scramble up a tree each.]

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [Looks around and then sighs in relief.] He's gone.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Merry!  [Pippin looks down in horror but as he turns his head, he spots a pair of gleaming yellow eyes blinking in the tree hes clinging to. The tree starts to move and groan.]

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Hooooo...

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Argh!!

Speaker: grishnkh
Dialogue: Lets put a maggot-hole in your belly. [Suddenly he senses something behind him and as he looks up, the tree stomps and squashes him onto the forest floor.]

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Run, Merry!  [Merry tries to run away but is scooped by the tree.]

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: [Looks at the creatures in his hands] Little Orcs! Burrum...

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Its talking, Merry. The tree is talking!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Tree?! I am no tree. I am an Ent. [Stomps slowly through the forest.]

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: A treeherder! A shepherd of the forest.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Dont talk to it, Merry. Dont encourage it.

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Treebeard, some call me.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: And whose side are you on?

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Side? I am on nobodys side because nobodys on my side, little Orc. Nobody cares for the woods anymore.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Were not Orcs. Were Hobbits!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Hobbits? Never heard of a hobbit before. Sounds like Orc mischief to me! [Tightens his hold on the hobbits and squeezes them. Merry and Pippin whimpers in pain] They come with fire, they come with axes. Gnawing, biting, breaking, hacking, burning! Destroyers and usurpers, curse them!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: No, you dont understand. Were Hobbits... Halflings! Shirefolk!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Maybe you are and maybe you arent. The White Wizard will know.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: The White Wizard?

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Saruman.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: See, see, we have led you out! Hurry hobbitses hurry. Very lucky we find you.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Nice hobbit. [Leaps after Frodo, putting a wide berth between him and Sam.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Whoa, its a bog! Hes led us into a swamp!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: A swamp, yes, yes. Come, master. We will take you on safe paths through the mist. Come, hobbits, come. We go quickly.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: I found it, I did. The way through the marshes. Orcs don't use it. Orcs don't know it. They go round for miles and miles. Come quickly. Swift and quick as shadows we must be.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: There are dead things! Dead faces in the water!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: All dead. All rotten. Elves and men and orcses. A great battle long ago. [Turns to face the hobbits.] The Dead Marshes. Yes, yes that is their name. This way. Dont follow the lights.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ohh!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Careful now, or hobbits go down to join the dead ones and light little candles of their own.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Frodo!  [Frodo is in the water and sees many faces of the dead, no longer still but screaming and grasping, their rotten robes and hair flowing about their gruesome faces. Their hands are reaching for him. Suddenly he is grabbed from behind. Frodo sputters and gasps for air as Gollum pulls him out of the water.]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Looks at Gollum in perplexed gratitude and disbelief.] Gollum...

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Dont follow the lights! [Crawls away]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Runs to Frodos side.] Mr. Frodo! Are you alright?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Sooo bright. Sooo beautiful. [Frodo quickly puts the Ring back inside his shirt. He looks up to see Gollum crouching away from him, stroking the centre of his palm] our preciousss...

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master should be resting. Master needs to keep up his strength.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Moves over and crouches in front of Gollum] Who are you?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Mustnt ask us. Not its business. *Gollum, Gollum*

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Gandalf told me you were one of the River Folk.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Cold be heart and hand and bone. Cold be travellers far from home.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: He said your life was a sad story.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: They do not see what lies ahead, when sun has failed and moon is dead.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: You were not so very different from a hobbit once, were you... Smagol?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Looks up slowly.] What did you call me?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: That was your name once, wasnt it? A long time ago.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: My name... My name... S... S...Smagol

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Argh!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Black Riders!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Hide! Hide!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Argh!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Argh!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Cmon Frodo! C'mon!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Quick! They will see us! They will see us!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I thought they were dead!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Dead? No, you cannot kill them. No.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [cowering] Wraiths! Wraiths on wings! They are calling for it. They are calling for the preciousss.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr. Frodo! Its alright. Im here.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Hurry, hobbits. The Black Gate is very close.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Spits] Ptui! Orc blood.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: These are strange tracks.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: The air is so close in here.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: This forest is old. Very old. Full of memory... and anger.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: The trees are speaking to each other.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Whispers] Gimli!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Gestures] Lower your axe.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Lowering his axe slowly] Oh.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Aragorn, nad n ennas!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Man cenich?

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: The White Wizard approaches.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Do not let him speak. He will put a spell on us.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: We must be quick.  [With a yell, the three swing round to attack. Gimlis axe and Legolas arrow are deflected. Aragorn drops his sword as it becomes red hot in his grasp. They shield their eyes with their hands from the bright light emanating from the White Wizard.]

Speaker: white wizard
Dialogue: You are tracking the footsteps of two young hobbits.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: white wizard
Dialogue: They passed this way the day before yesterday. They met someone they did not expect. Does that comfort you?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Who are you? Show yourself!  [The bright light dims, revealing Gandalf, all dressed in white. The three are astounded. Legolas and Gimli bow.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: It cannot be. You fell.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Through fire and water. [Flashback: Gandalf is battling the Balrog atop Drins Tower.] From the lowest dungeon to the highest peak, I fought with the Balrog of Morgoth.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Until at last, I threw down my enemy and smote his ruin upon the mountainside.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Darkness took me. And I strayed out of thought and time. [Camera zooms in Gandalfs eye and enters an amorphous realm of stars and galaxies, ending in a blinding white light] Stars wheeled overhead and everyday was as long as a life-age of the earth. But it was not the end. I felt life in me again.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: I've been sent back until my task is done.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gandalf!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Gandalf? Yes... That's what they used to call me. Gandalf the Grey. That was my name. [He smiles]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Gandalf!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: [With a twinkle in his eye] I am Gandalf the White. [Aragorn grins] And I come back to you now at the turn of the tide.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: One stage of your journey is over, another begins. War has come to Rohan. We must ride to Edoras with all speed.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: That is one of the Mearas, unless my eyes are cheated by some spell.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Shadowfax. [Gimli bows in the background.] He's the lord of all horses and he's been my friend through many dangers.

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: My home lies deep in the forest near the roots of the mountain. I told Gandalf I would keep you safe and safe is where Ill keep you. The trees have grown wild and dangerous. Anger festers in their hearts. They will harm you if they can. There are too few of us now. Too few of us Ents left to manage them.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: The Black Gate of Mordor.  [The enormous Black Gate comes into view with Orcs patrolling and standing guard on the towers and atop the walls. From the right, an army of Easterling soldiers is marching to the Black Gate.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Oh save us. My ol' Gaffer'd have a thing or two to say if he could see us now.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master says to show him the way into Mordor, so good Smagol does. Master says so.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: I did.  [Orcs are patrolling the Black Gate.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thats it then. We cannot get past that.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Look! The gate, it's opening! I can see a way down.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Sam, no!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Argh!!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: I do not ask you to come with me, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I know, Mr Frodo. I doubt even these Elvish cloaks will hide us in there.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: No! No, no master! They catch you! They catch you! Dont take it to him! He wants the preciousss. Always hes looking for it! And the preciousss is wanting to go back to him. But we mustnt let him have it.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: No! [Pulls Frodo back again.] Theres another way. More secret. A dark way.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Why havent you spoken of this before?!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Because Master did not ask!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hes up to something.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Are you saying theres another way into Mordor?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Yes. There is a path, and some stairs, and then a tunnel. [Frodo and Sam watch as the Black Gate closes. Gollum is stroking Frodos arm and burying his face in his cloak.]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Hes led us this far, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr. Frodo, no.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Hes been true to his word.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Whispers] No!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Lead the way, Smagol.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Good Smagol always helps.

Speaker: gandalf

Dialogue: Will you not go to him? [She weeps.] Will you do nothing?

Dialogue: Be careful what you say. Do not look for welcome here.

Dialogue: I understand his passing is hard to accept, especially now that your brother has deserted you.

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: [jumps back and throws off Grmas hand] Leave me alone, snake!

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: So fair, so cold, like a morning of pale spring still clinging to winter's chill.

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: Your words are poison!  [owyn runs out of the hall. Weeping, she looks away into the distance. Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Youll find more cheer in a graveyard.

Dialogue: [sees Hma] Ah.

Speaker: hma
Dialogue: [gestures to Gandalf] Your staff.

Dialogue: Hmm? [Glances at his staff.] Oh. You would not part an old man from his walking stick? [Looks at Hma innocently.]

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: [Leaning down and whispering to Thoden.] My lord, Gandalf the Grey is coming. Hes a herald of woe.

Dialogue: The courtesy of your hall is somewhat lessened of late, Thoden King.

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: [Whispering to Thoden.] Hes not welcome.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Why should I welcome you, Gandalf Stormcrow? [Looks to Grma for affirmation.]

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: A just question, my liege. [He walks towards Gandalf.] Late is the hour in which this conjurer chooses to appear. Lathspell spell I name him. Ill news is an ill guest.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Be silent! Keep your forked tongue behind you teeth. I have not passed through fire and death to bandy crooked words with a witless worm! [Raises his staff against Grma.]

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: His staff! [Backing away from Gandalf while addressing the guards] I told you to take the wizards staff!

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Thoden, son of Thengel, too long have you sat in the shadows.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Growls] I would stay still, if I were you.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Hearken to me! I release you from the spell. [Gestures with his hand]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Menacingly] Hahahhhahahahah! [Gandalf opens his eyes in surprise.] You have no power here, Gandalf the Grey!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Argh!

Dialogue: [Points his staff towards Thoden.] I will draw you, Saruman, as poison is drawn from a wound.

Dialogue: Wait.

Speaker: thoden

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [in Saruman's voice] Rohan is mine!

Dialogue: [Looks closely at owyn] I know your face. owyn owyn.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Gandalf?

Speaker: thoden

Dialogue: Argh! [Beseechingly to Thoden] I've only ever served you, my lord!

Dialogue: [Grovelling] Send me not from your side.

Speaker: grma
Dialogue: Get out of my way!

Dialogue: Thodreds death was not of your making.

Dialogue: Who are they?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: To make his war. The last war that will cover all the world in shadow.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Weve got to get moving. Come on, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Suddenly grabs Frodos arm] Mr Frodo! Look! Its an Oliphaunt!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No one at home will believe this...

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Looking around] Smagol?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Weve lingered here too long. Come on, Sam!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ah!  [He charges at Faramir but is grabbed by another ranger and thrown down. A sword appears at his throat. Faramir appears.]

Dialogue: Bind their hands.

Dialogue: [Gestures and whispers] Its the beards....

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: [Laughs gaily] Hahahaha!!

Dialogue: Hehehe! Which is of course ridiculous Whoa!!

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: Ooh! [She rushes forward to Gimli]

Dialogue: [Struggling to get up] Its alright, its alright. Nobody panic. That was deliberate. It was deliberate.

Dialogue: Ae -esteliach nad... estelio han. Estelio ammen.

Dialogue: Idhren emmen menna gui ethwel. Hae o auth a nr a naeth.

Dialogue: This belongs to you.

Dialogue: My lord?

Dialogue: She is sailing to the Undying Lands, with all that is left of her kin.

Dialogue: What is it? Hma?

Dialogue: [Looking around] Im not sure.

Dialogue: Argh! [Shouts to Aragorn] A scout!

Dialogue: What is it? What do you see?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Running back to Thoden] Wargs! We are under attack!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Get them out of here!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: All riders to the head of the column!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Trying to mount Arod] Come on, get me up here, Im a rider! Argh!

Dialogue: [To owyn] You must lead the people to Helms Deep. And make haste!

Speaker: owyn
Dialogue: I can fight!

Dialogue: No! You must do this... for me.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [To his men] Follow me! Yah!

Dialogue: [To the villagers] Make for the lower ground! Stick together!

Dialogue: CHARGE!!

Dialogue: [Jumping back as the warg falls, outraged] Argh! That one counts as mine!

Dialogue: [Looking around] Aragorn!

Dialogue: Aragorn?

Dialogue: [Looks towards the edge of the cliff, and grabs Sharku] You lie!

Dialogue: [To his men] Get the wounded on horses. The wolves of Isengard will return. Leave the dead.

Dialogue: [Puts a hand on Legolas' shoulder] Come.

Dialogue: [To owyn] Were safe, my lady! Thank you!

Dialogue: Mama!

Dialogue: othain! Freda!

Dialogue: Make way for Thoden!

Dialogue: Make way for the king!

Dialogue: [Looking about] So few. So few of you have returned.

Dialogue: [Dismounting] Our people are safe. We have paid for it with many lives.

Dialogue: [Going up to owyn] My lady...

Dialogue: Lord Aragorn, where is he?

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: What news?

Speaker: madril
Dialogue: Our scouts report Saruman has attacked Rohan. Thodens people have fled to Helms Deep. [Points at the map] But we must look to our own borders. Faramir, Orcs are on the move. Sauron is marshalling an army. Easterlings and Southrons are passing through the Black Gate.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: How many?

Speaker: madril
Dialogue: Some thousands. More come every day.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Whos covering the river to the north?

Speaker: madril
Dialogue: We pulled 500 men at Osgiliath, but if the city is attacked, we wont hold it.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: [Tracing on the map] Saruman attacks from Isengard. Sauron from Mordor. The fight will come to men on both fronts. Gondor is weak. Sauron will strike us soon. And he will strike hard. He knows now we do not have the strength to repel him.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: My men tell me that you are Orc spies.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Spies?! Now wait just a minute!

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Well if youre not spies, then who are you?

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Speak.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: We are hobbits of the Shire. Frodo Baggins is my name and this is Samwise Gamgee.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Your bodyguard?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: His gardener.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: And where is your skulking friend? That gangrel creature. He had an ill-favoured look.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [The merest hesitation.] There was no other.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: We set out from Rivendell with seven companions. One we lost in Mria. Two were my kin. A Dwarf there was also, and an Elf. And two men, Aragorn, son of Arathorn, and Boromir of Gondor.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: [Intently] Youre a friend of Boromir?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Yes... for my part.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: It will grieve you then to learn that he is dead.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Shocked] Dead? How? When?

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: As one of his companions, Id hoped you would tell me. [Pause] He was my brother.

Speaker: gondorian ranger
Dialogue: Captain Faramir. [whispers] We found the third one.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: You must come with me. Now.  [Frodo gets up and follow. They come to the edge of the waterfall, overlooking the Forbidden Pool.]

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: [Pointing down] Down there.  [Frodo looks down and sees Gollum diving into the water.]

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: To enter the forbidden pool bears the penalty of death. [He gestures to archers hidden in the bushes.] They wait for my command.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Shall I shoot?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [singing] The rock and pool is nice and cool, so juicy sweet! I only wish [Whacks the fish on the rock] to catch a fish [whacks], so juicy sweet! [The fish almost wriggles out of his grasp and he whacks it some more.]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Wait! [Faramir stops] This creature is bound to me. And I to him. He is our guide. Please, let me go down to him.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Smagol. [Gollum turns round at Frodos voice.] Master is here. Come, Smagol. Trust master. Come!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: We must go now?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Smagol, you must trust master. Follow me, come on. Come. Come, Smagol. Nice Smagol. Thats it. Come on.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Dont hurt him! Smagol dont struggle! Smagol listen to me!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [wails] Master!!  [A black cloth is brought over Gollum's head. Frodo stares after them with a stricken expression as Faramir leads Gollum and his men away. Back in the cave, Gollum is thrown down to the ground. Crying, he crawls into a corner and curls up into ball.]

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: No! No!

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Where are you leading them? Answer me!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Cooing, his hand stroking his shoulder] Smagol... Why does it cry, Smagol?

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: [Sobbing] Cruel men hurts us. Master trickst us.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Of course he did. I told you he was tricksy. I told you he was false.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: [Sobbing] Master is our friend... our friend.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master betrayed us.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: No, not its business. Leave us alone!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Hits his fist against the wall] Filthy little hobbitses. They stole it from us.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: [Whimpers] No... No!

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: What did they steal?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Turns to Faramir with a ferocious expression] Myyy PRECIOUSSS!! [He bares his teeth and growls] Aaaarrrggghhh!!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We have to get out of here. You go. Go, now! You can do it. Use the Ring, Mr. Frodo. Just this once. Put it on. Disappear.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: I cant. You were right, Sam. You tried to tell me, but Im sorry. The Rings taking me Sam. If I put it on, hell find me. Hell see.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr. Frodo...  [They both stand as Faramir enters.]

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: [Unsheathes his sword] So... this is the answer to all the riddles. Here in the wild I have you. Two halflings and a host of men at my call. The Ring of power within my grasp.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: A chance for Faramir, captain of Gondor, to show his quality.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: No!! [He runs away from Faramir]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Stop it! Leave him alone! Dont you understand? Hes got to destroy it. Thats where were going. Into Mordor. To the mountain of fire.

Speaker: damrod
Dialogue: Osgiliath is under attack. They call for reinforcements.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Please. Its such a burden. Will you not help him?

Speaker: damrod
Dialogue: Captain?

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Prepare to leave. The Ring will go to Gondor. [He turns to leave.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Patting Brego on the neck] Mae carnen, Brego, mellon nn.

Speaker: refugees
Dialogue: Hes alive!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Pushing his way through the crowd.] Where is he? Where is he? Get out of the way. Im gonna kill him! [He sees Aragorn.] You are the luckiest, the canniest and the most reckless man I ever knew! [He hugs Aragorn.] Bless you, laddie!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gimli, where is the king?  [Gimli gestures to the hall. As Aragorn makes his way in, he runs into Legolas who stands waiting.]

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Le ab-dollen.  [They smile. Legolas pauses and looks at Aragorns wounds.] You look terrible.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Hannon le.   [owyn looks on and smiles even as tears fill her eyes.]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: A great host, you say?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: All Isengard is emptied

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: How many?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Ten thousand strong at least.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Ten thousand?!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: It is an army bred for a single purpose: to destroy the world of men. They will be here by nightfall.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Let them come! [Walks away resolutely]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [to Gamling] I want every man and strong lad able to bear arms to be ready for battle by nightfall.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: We will cover the causeway and the gate from above. No army has ever breached the Deeping Wall or set foot inside the Hornburg.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: This is no rabble of mindless Orcs. These are Uruk-hai. Their armor is thick and their shields broad.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: I have fought many wars, Master Dwarf. I know how to defend my own keep.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: They will break upon this fortress like water on rock. Sarumans hordes will pillage and burn, weve seen it before. Crops can be resown; homes rebuilt. Within these walls, we will outlast them.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: They do not come to destroy Rohans crops or villages. They come to destroy its people. Down to the last child.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Draws close to Aragorn] What would you have me do? Look at my men. Their courage hangs by a thread. If this is to be our end, then I would have them make such an end as to be worthy of remembrance.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Send out riders, my lord. You must call for aid.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: And who will come? Elves? Dwarves? We are not so lucky in our friends as you. The old alliances are dead.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gondor will answer.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Gondor? Where was Gondor when the Westfold fell? Where was Gondor when our enemies closed in around us? Where was Gon No, my lord Aragorn, we are alone. [He walks away, calling out orders] Get the women and children into the caves.

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: We need more time to lay provisions for a siege, lord

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Cutting him off] There is no time. War is upon us!

Speaker: rohan captain
Dialogue: [to the soldiers] Secure the gate!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: We Ents have not troubled about the wars of men and wizards for a very long time. But now something is about to happen that has not happened for an age... Ent Moot.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Whats that?

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: 'Tis a gathering.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: A gathering of what?

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Beech, oak, chestnut, ash... Good, good, good. Many have come. Now we must decide if the Ents will go to war.

Speaker: soldier 1
Dialogue: Move back! Move to the caves!

Speaker: soldier 2
Dialogue: Keep moving!

Speaker: soldier 3
Dialogue: Quickly now!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Farmer, farriers, stable boys. These are no soldiers.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Most have seen too many winters.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Or too few. Look at them. Theyre frightened. I can see it in their eyes. [The men around them fell silent. Legolas speaks to Aragorn.] Boe a hn: neled herain dan caer menig!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Si beriathar hn. Amar n ned Edoras.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Aragorn, men i ndagor. Hn -... ortheri. Natha daged aen!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Then I shall die as one them! [He pauses and then walks away. Legolas makes as if to go after him.]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Puts a hand on Legolas] Let him go, lad. Let him be.

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Every villager able to wield a sword has been sent to the armory. My lord?

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Who am I, Gamling?

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: You are our king, sire.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: And do you trust your king?

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: [Puts armour onto Thoden] Your men, my lord, will follow you to whatever end.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: To whatever end Where is the horse and the rider? Where is the horn that was blowing? They have passed like rain on the mountains. Like wind in the meadow. The days have gone down in the west. Behind the hills, into shadow. How did it come to this?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Give me your sword. What is your name?

Speaker: haleth
Dialogue: Haleth, son of Hma, my lord. The men are saying that we will not live out the night. They say that it is hopeless..

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: This is a good sword, Haleth, son of Hma.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: There is always hope.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: We have trusted you this far. You have not led us astray. Forgive me. I was wrong to despair.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: -moe edhored, Legolas.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: If we had more time Id get this adjusted. [He drops the bundle and the chain mail lands with its length right to the floor.] Its a little tight across the chest.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: That is no Orc horn. [They run out to the battlements.]

Speaker: bereg
Dialogue: [to another guard] Send for the king. Open the gate!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Open the gate!  [An army of Lothlrien Elves march up the Causeway into the Hornburg. They are led by Haldir. The Rohirrim soldiers look upon them in wonderment and delight as they pass.]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: How is this possible?

Speaker: haldir
Dialogue: I bring word from Elrond of Rivendell. An alliance once existed between Elves and men. Long ago we fought and died together. [He looks up to see Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli running down the steps, and smiles] We come to honor that allegiance.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [He bows] Mae govannen, Haldir.  [He grabs Haldir in a huge embrace. Initially stunned, Haldir hugs him back lightly.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: You are most welcome!  [Legolas and Haldir clasp each other on the shoulder.]

Speaker: haldir
Dialogue: [Turning to Thoden] We are proud to fight alongside men, once more.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Grumbling and straining to look above the wall.] You could have picked a better spot.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Well lad, whatever luck you live by, lets hope it lasts the night.

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Your friends are with you, Aragorn.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Lets hope they last the night.  [The marching and thumping grows louder and louder. Lightning flashes and it begins to rain. While the Uruk-hai army continues to march at the fortress, an Uruk-hai leader steps on a rock outcrop.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: A Eruchn, -dano i faelas a hyn an uben tanatha le faelas!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Jumping and straining to see] Whats happening out there?

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Shall I describe it to you? [Looks at Gimli with a grin] Or would you like me to find you a box?

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Laughs good-naturedly] Hehehehe!!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Dartho!   [The Uruk-hai army stop their roaring and thumping. With a hollow groan, the Uruk that was shot collapsed to the ground. The other Uruk-hai bare their teeth and roar with anger. With a cry, the Uruk-hai leader thrusts his weapon in the air and the Uruk-hai army starts charging.]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: So it begins.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Tangado halad!

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Faeg i-varv dn na lanc a nu ranc.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Leithio i philinn!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Did they hit anything?

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Give them a volley.

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: [to the men] Fire!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Fire!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Impatiently] Send them to me! Cmon!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Pendraid!   [The Elves draw their blades in preparation for combat. The first ladders are almost reaching the walls with big nasty Uruk Berserkers on top of them.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Swords! Swords!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Good!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Legolas, two already! [Holding up two fingers]

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Im on seventeen!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Outraged] Argh! Ill have no pointy-ear outscoring me! [He turns to a Uruk just climbing over the wall, whacking it in the groin with his axe and killing it as it falls.]

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: [Fires two arrows] Nineteen!

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: [Gesturing] Merry!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: We have just agreed. [Long pause with his eyes closed.]

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [Angles his head in query] Yes?

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: I have told your names to the Ent moot and we have agreed  you are not Orcs.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Well, thats good news.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [impatiently] And what about Saruman? Have you come to a decision about HIM?

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: [Waving a hand] Now dont be hasty, Master Meriadoc.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Hasty? Our friends are out there! They need our help! They cannot fight this war on their own.

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: War, yes It affects us all. But you must understand, young hobbit. It takes a loong time to say anything in ooold Entish. [Merry and Pippin roll their eyes in disgruntlement.] And we never say anything unless it is worth taking a looong time to say.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Seventeen! Eighteen! Nineteen! Twenty! Twenty-one! Twenty-two!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Na fennas!  [Directs the Elf archers to aim at the Uruk-hai column.]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Is this it? Is this all you can conjure, Saruman?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Togo hon dad, Legolas!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Brace the Gate! Hold them! Stand firm!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Aragorn!! Argh!  [He is soon overpowered. Aragorn gets up and sees Gimli falling.]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gimli! [He yells to the Elves behind him] Hado i philinn!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Herio!   [Aragorn leads the Elves in a charge towards the Uruk-hai streaming in. He rushes to Gimlis side and picks him up. At the top of the battlements, Legolas grabs a shield and sends it sliding across the ground. He then hops onto it and surfs down the steps, releasing three arrows as he goes, and kicking the shield to stab an Uruk-hai as he lands at the bottom.]

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: The Ents cannot hold back this storm. We must weather such things as we have always done.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: How can that be your decision?!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: This is not our war.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: But you're part of this world! Arent you?! [The Ents look at one another, taken back] You must help, please! You must do something!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: You are young and brave, Master Merry. But your part in this tale is over. Go back to your home.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Maybe Treebeards right. We dont belong here, Merry. It's too big for us. What can we do in the end? We've got the Shire. Maybe we should go home.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: [Looking into the distance.] The fires of Isengard will spread. And the woods of Tuckborough and Buckland will burn. And all that was once green and good in this world will be gone. [Turns to Pippin and puts a hand on his shoulder] There won't be a Shire, Pippin.

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Aragorn! Fall back to the Keep! Get your men out of there!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Na Barad! Na Baraad! Haldir, na Barad!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Protesting] What are you doing? Argh! What are you stopping for!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Sees Haldir falling] HALDIR!! [He runs up the steps to Haldirs side and catches him and he collapses. Haldir's head rolls back, his eyes empty and unseeing. Aragorn bows his head in grief. Then with a cry, he jumps onto a ladder and swings down to the ground, killing as he goes.]

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Brace the gate!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Hold them!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Drawing his sword] To the gate! Draw your swords!

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Make way! We cannot hold much longer.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Hold them!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Runs up and stabs away at the Uruk-hai through the broken gate] How long do you need?

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Brace the gate!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: As long as you can give me!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gimli!

Speaker: theoden
Dialogue: Timbers! Brace the Gate!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Come on! We can take em!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Its a long way.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Mumbles] Toss me.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: I cannot jump the distance! Youll have to toss me!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Oh! [Gimli stays Aragorns hand] Dont tell the Elf.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Not a word.  [He tosses Gimli to the head of the Causeway and then leaps over.]

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: [Making quick work of killing the Uruk-hai] ARGH!!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Shore up the door!

Speaker: soldier 1
Dialogue: Make way!

Speaker: soldier 2
Dialogue: Follow me to the barricade.

Speaker: soldier 3
Dialogue: Watch our backs!

Speaker: soldier 4
Dialogue: Throw another one over here!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Higher!

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Hold fast the gate!]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Through a crack in the gate] Gimli! Aragorn! Get out of there!

Speaker: legolas
Dialogue: Aragorn! [He throws them a rope]  [Aragorn grabs Gimli in one hand and the rope with the other as they are pulled up the wall. Just then the Uruk-hai load and fires enormous hooks over the battlements. Hundred of Uruk-hai climb onto super-ladders as they are pulled up towards the walls, the super-ladders locking onto the edge of the battlements with their steel grips. Legolas takes aim as another super-ladder is being pulled up and shoots away one of the ropes. The ladder falls back onto the Uruk-hai army.]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Pull everybody back! Pull them back!

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Fall back! Fall back!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Theyve broken through! The castle is breached. Retreat!

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Fall back!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Retreat!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Hurry! Inside! Get them inside!

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: Into the Keep!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: I will leave you at the western borders of the forest. You can make your way north to your homeland from there.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Wait! Stop! Stop! [Treebeard comes to a stop.] Turn around. Turn around. Take us south!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: South? But that will lead you past Isengard.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Yes. Exactly. If we go south we can slip past Saruman unnoticed. The closer we are to danger, the farther we are from harm. Its the last thing hell expect.

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Mmmm. That doesnt make sense to me. But then, you are very small. Perhaps youre right. South it is then. Hold on, little Shirelings. I always like going south. Somehow it feels like going down hill.

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Are you mad? Well be caught!

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: No we wont. Not this time.

Speaker: ranger 1
Dialogue: Look! Osgiliath burns!

Speaker: ranger 2
Dialogue: Mordor has come.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [With tears in his eyes] The Ring will not save Gondor. It has only the power to destroy. Please, let me go.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Hurry. [He presses them on]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Faramir, you must let me go!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: And a little family of field mice that climb up sometimes and they tickle me awfully. Theyre always trying to get somewhere where they  Oh!! [He sees the desolated landscape of tree stumps that used to be forested grounds] Many of these trees were my friends. Creatures I had known from nut and acorn.

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Im sorry, Treebeard.

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: [With tears in his eyes] They had voices of their own. [His gaze turns to the treeless Isengard and its smoking caverns] Saruman! A wizard should know better!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: There is no curse in Elvish, Entish or the tongues of men for this treachery. My business is with Isengard tonight. With rock and stone!

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Hoorarooom... Come my friends. The Ents are going to war. It is likely that we go to our doom. Last march of the Ents!

Speaker: madril
Dialogue: Faramir, Orcs have taken the eastern shore. Their numbers are too great. By nightfall well be overrun.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr Frodo!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Its calling to him, Sam. His eye is almost on me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hold on, Mr. Frodo You'll be alright...

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Take them to my father. Tell him Faramir sends a mighty gift. A weapon that will change our fortunes in this war.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Do you want to know what happened to Boromir? You want to know why your brother died? He tried to take the Ring from Frodo! After swearing an oath to protect him, he tried to kill him! The Ring drove your brother mad!

Speaker: ranger
Dialogue: Watch out!  [A boulder crashes into a tower overhead and shatters it. Suddenly, Frodos eyes roll up and he stares at Faramir strangely.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mr Frodo?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [In a faraway voice] Theyre here. Theyve come.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: [Looking up] NAZGL!! [He grabs the hobbits and thrusts them into a corner.] Stay here. Keep out of sight. [To his men] Take cover!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: The fortress is taken. It is over.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Carrying a table with Legolas to shore up the door of the hall] You said this fortress would never fall while your men defend it! They still defend it! They have died defending it!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: They are breaking in!

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Is there no other way for the women and children to get out of the caves? [There is no answer.] Is there no other way?

Speaker: gamling
Dialogue: There is one passage. It leads into the mountains. But they will not get far. The Uruk-hai are too many.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Send word for the women and children to make for the mountain pass. And barricade the entrance.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: So much death. What can men do against such reckless hate?

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: [Pause] Ride out with me. Ride out and meet them.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [A light of determination shines in his eyes] For death and glory.

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: For Rohan. For your people.

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: The sun is rising.

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Yes. Yes! The horn of Helm Hammerhand shall sound in the deep one last time!

Speaker: gimli
Dialogue: Yes! [Gimli runs up the steps to the horn of Helm Hammerhand]

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Let this be the hour when we draw swords together. Fell deeds awake. Now for wrath! Now for ruin! And a red dawn!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: FORTH EORLINGAS!!  [Thoden leads the charge out of the keep into the Hornburg, slashing away at the Uruk-hai as they go. Without pause, they storm out of the gate and down the Causeway, right into the column of waiting Uruk-hai. In the midst of battle, Aragorn looks east and sees a white rider against the rising sun]

Speaker: aragorn
Dialogue: Gandalf.

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Thoden king stands alone.

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: [Coming up from behind] Not alone. [He raises a hand] Rohirrim!!

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: [Looking to the east] omer!

Speaker: omer
Dialogue: To the king!

Speaker: pippin
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: A hit. A fine hit!

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Break the dam! Release the river!  [The dam is broken and Saruman looks up to see the river rushing down the slope towards Isengard, washing away Orcs and wooden structures in its path. ]

Speaker: merry
Dialogue: Pippin, hold on! [The hobbits tighten their hold on top of Treebeard]

Speaker: treebeard
Dialogue: Hold on, little hobbits!  [Treebeard braces himself against the flood. As the water rushes over Isengard, an Ent rushes in and thrusts his burning body into the water. The water rushes into the caverns, washing away the bridges, mechanisms and structures within.]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What are you doing? Where are you going?!

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Aaarrgghh!!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [With tears running down his face] Its me. Its your Sam. Dont you know your Sam?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [Slowly and with despair] I cant do this, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Getting up slowly] I know. Its all wrong. By rights we shouldnt even be here. But we are. [He stands and leans against a wall, looking out into the distance.] Its like in the great stories, Mr. Frodo. The ones that really mattered. Full of darkness and danger they were. And sometimes you didnt want to know the end. Because how could the end be happy? [Images of the riders winning the battle against the Uruk-hai at Helms Deep] How could the world go back to the way it was when so much bad had happened?

Speaker: thoden
Dialogue: Victory! We have victory! [He raises his sword with a victorious cry]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: But in the end, its only a passing thing, this shadow. [The women and children welcome the men as they return. owyn runs up to Aragorn and embraces him, crying tears of relief.] Even darkness must pass. A new day will come. [Isengard is flooded. Merry and Pippin looks on from their perch on Treebeard. On the balcony, Saruman stumbles back into his chamber] And when the sun shines it will shine out the clearer. Those were the stories that stayed with you. That meant something, even if you were too small to understand why. But I think, Mr. Frodo, I do understand. I know now. Folk in those stories had lots of chances of turning back only they didnt. They kept going because they were holding on to something.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: What are we holding on to, Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Theres some good in this world, Mr. Frodo. And its worth fighting for.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: I think at last we understand one another, Frodo Baggins.

Speaker: madril
Dialogue: You know the laws of our country, the laws of your father. If you let them go, your life will be forfeit.

Speaker: faramir
Dialogue: Then it is forfeit. Release them.  [Sam shakes the rangers hand from his shoulder. Frodo looks up at Faramir with gladness. Over in the realm of Rohan, Gandalf, Thoden and company ride to the top of a slope, looking towards the Mountain of Fire in the distance.]

Speaker: gandalf
Dialogue: Saurons wrath will be terrible, his retribution swift. The battle for Helms Deep is over. The battle for Middle-earth is about to begin. All our hopes now lie with two little hobbits. Somewhere in the wilderness.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I wonder if well ever be put into songs or tales.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I wonder if people will ever say, lets hear about Frodo and the Ring. And theyll say yes, thats one of my favorite stories. Frodo was really courageous, wasnt he, dad. Yes, my boy, the most famousest of hobbits. And thats saying alot.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Huh, you left out one of the chief characters Samwise the Brave. I want to hear more about Sam.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Frodo wouldnt have got far without Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Now Mr. Frodo, you shouldnt make fun. I was being serious.

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: [smiling] So was I. [He turns to walk on]

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: [Dreamily] Samwise the Brave. [He gives his backpack a heave and follows Frodo]

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Smagol!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Were not gonna wait for you. Come on!

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Master... Master looks after us. Master wouldnt hurt us.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master broke his promise.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Dont ask Smagol. Poor, poor Smagol.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Master betrayed us! Wicked, tricksy, false. We ought to wring his filthy little neck. [Twists the branch of a tree] Kill him! Kill him! Kill them both. And then we take the precious and we be the master.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: [Scuttles and hides behind a tree] The fat hobbit, he knows. Eyes always watching.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Then we stabs them out. Put out his eyeses. And make HIM crawl.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: [Bites on his finger and nods eagerly] Yes! Yes! Yes!

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Kill them both.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Yes! No no! [Backs away against a tree] Its too risky, its too risky.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Wheres he gone? Hey Gollum, where are you?

Speaker: frodo
Dialogue: Smagol?

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: [Softly and sinisterly] We could let HER do it.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Yes. She could do it.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Yes, precious she could. And then we takes it once theyre dead.

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Once theyre dead

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Shh [He pops out from hiding in front of the hobbits.]

Speaker: smagol
Dialogue: Come on, hobbits. Long ways to go yet. Smagol will show you the way.

Speaker: gollum
Dialogue: Follow me.  [ Camera pans up over the forest and Ephel Dath to reveal the desolation of Mordor. To the left of the frame is the glowing Eye of Sauron atop Barad-dr, and to the right of the frame is the fiery Mount Doom. Three Fell Beasts circle the dark skies. Lightning flashes as the scene fades to black.]
